title: 'Wholesale attack on democracy in India': Rahul targets Centre, PM from Colombia; BJP hits back
content: Rahul Gandhi, Leader of Opposition, accused the BJP-led central government of a “wholesale attack on Indian democracy” during an interaction in Colombia, emphasizing India's diverse traditions needing democratic space. The BJP hit back, calling him a “Leader of Propaganda” for denigrating Indian democracy abroad and wanting to "fight Indian state."

title: UK synagogue attack: 2 dead, 3 hurt in mass stabbing; suspect shot by cops
content: Two people were killed and three injured in a stabbing and car attack at a synagogue in Crumpsall, UK, on Yom Kippur. Police shot the suspect and declared a 'Plato' incident, a code for a marauding terror attack. UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer condemned the horrific event and will chair an emergency meeting.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row fallout: Bareilly on high alert, drones deployed; net suspended
content: Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly division is under heightened security for Dussehra, with drones and armed police deployed. Bareilly district faces a 48-hour internet suspension until October 4, following September 26 unrest. This measure aims to curb rumour-mongering and communal tension on social media. Four districts are on high alert, with officials warned against lapses.

title: Delhi, J'khand ... now Bihar: BJP plays 'infiltrators' card to corner oppn - will it work?
content: Bihar is witnessing a fierce political battle over "illegal migration," with Prime Minister Modi accusing the Mahagathbandhan of shielding foreign infiltrators. This offensive, a recurring BJP poll strategy, targets the opposition ahead of elections, particularly in the Muslim-majority Seemanchal region. While BJP officially cites development, the infiltration narrative aims to reshape electoral dynamics, echoing past campaigns in Delhi and Jharkhand.

title: Microsoft leadership change: CEO freed from some duties - Read Nadella’s email to staff
content: Microsoft is reorganizing its top leadership, appointing Judson Althoff as CEO of Commercial Business to oversee marketing and operations. This strategic shift allows CEO Satya Nadella and engineering leaders to intensely focus on AI, data center expansion, and product development. The move aims to accelerate AI transformation and strengthen customer feedback loops across the company.

title: Captain’s faith: 'Even if you get out for 15 ducks' - how SKY backed Abhishek Sharma
content: Abhishek Sharma, Player of the Tournament in Asia Cup 2025, attributes his sensational form to captain Suryakumar Yadav's unwavering faith. Yadav assured him of his place despite early failures, transforming Abhishek's approach. He adopted an aggressive batting style, leading to a record 931 T20I rating points.

title: Aravind Srinivas named India’s youngest billionaire – who is he?
content: Chennai-born Aravind Srinivas, 31, has emerged as India's youngest billionaire, debuting on the M3M Hurun India Rich List 2025 with a net worth of Rs 21,190 crore from his AI startup Perplexity. His entry highlights a significant shift in India's wealth landscape, driven by young tech entrepreneurs in AI and digital platforms.

title: Water cannons & global backlash: Israel stops 19 Gaza aid boats — How it all unfolded
content: The Israeli navy intercepted a pro-Palestinian flotilla, including Greta Thunberg, sailing towards Gaza to challenge an 18-year blockade. Activists faced water cannons and detention, sparking international condemnation from nations like Turkey and Colombia. Despite these actions, some vessels continue their mission to deliver symbolic aid and open a humanitarian corridor.

title: US H-1B visa fees hike: Nvidia CEO backs Trump’s ‘reform’; issues talent warning
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang endorsed President Trump's H-1B visa reforms but warned the new $100,000 application fee is prohibitively expensive. He cautioned this steep cost could deter global tech talent and students, potentially driving investment away from the US. Huang stressed that attracting the "brightest minds" remains crucial for America's future, despite supporting immigration system overhaul efforts.

title: Asia Cup: 'Politics should stay aside' - AB de Villiers slams post-match chaos
content: South Africa cricket legend AB de Villiers criticised India's refusal to accept the Asia Cup trophy from the ACC President, urging a clear separation of sports and geopolitics, calling the ceremony awkward. He praised India's strong performance and composure throughout the tournament, highlighting Tilak Varma's crucial innings in their triumph.

title: 'Any misadventure ...': Rajnath flags Pak military build-up in Sir Creek; warns of ‘decisive response’
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh blamed Pakistan’s unclear intentions for the unresolved Sir Creek border dispute, warning of strong retaliation against any provocation. Citing Operation Sindoor, he praised India’s military strength in tackling threats, including Pakistan’s failed infiltration attempts. Singh stressed that while India has the power to respond forcefully, its actions remain focused on countering terrorism, not waging war.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won’t be updated until…
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: MP: Teacher, wife bury newborn alive over 2-child policy fear; baby survives
content: A government school teacher and his wife in Madhya Pradesh allegedly buried their three-day-old son alive in a forest, fearing job loss under the state's two-child policy. The baby, their fourth child, miraculously survived after villagers rescued him. The couple now faces attempt-to-murder charges, revealing a tragic consequence of the policy and MP's high infant abandonment rates.

title: 'If my value isn't met': Ashwin on going unsold in ILT20 auction; reveals future plans
content: R Ashwin went unsold in the ILT20 2025 auction due to his $120,000 base price, stating he's content if his value isn't met. He has committed to playing the entire BBL 2025 season with Sydney Thunder, becoming the first high-profile Indian man to do so.

title: 'Mahatma Gandhi statue restored': London monument repaired after vandalism
content: The Mahatma Gandhi statue in London's Tavistock Square, recently vandalized, has been fully restored just in time for Gandhi Jayanti and the International Day of Non-Violence. Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami paid tribute, highlighting its significance for India-UK friendship and the enduring message of non-violence. The restoration symbolizes renewal after the defacement.

title: Fatty liver disease: Common leg symptom may be an early warning, doctor reveals
content: Fatty liver disease, particularly NAFLD, is a growing global concern largely driven by lifestyle factors. Gastroenterologist Dr. Pradip Vekariya highlights pedal edema, or swollen feet, as a crucial yet often-ignored early warning sign of liver damage. He stresses the importance of early detection through a simple pitting test to prevent the disease's progression and save lives.

title: 'Mock Taipei': China steps up Taiwan invasion plan; replica war zone triples in size
content: China has significantly expanded its mock Taipei government buildings at the Zhurihe Training Base, tripling its size since 2020. This includes replicas of key institutions and a symbolic tunnel, indicating intensified military preparations and urban warfare drills. Experts view this as refining invasion strategies and psychological warfare against Taiwan, demanding heightened vigilance.

title: Olivia Culpo's heartwarming toast to sister Aurora’s Paris engagement
content: Olivia Culpo celebrated her sister Aurora's engagement to Zac, announced via a dreamy Instagram post. This joyous occasion follows a period of family tension, now showcasing reconciliation and strong sibling bonds. With Olivia recently embracing motherhood, the Culpo family highlights a season of growth, love, and shared milestones for fans.

title: Bumrah sets new mark: Fastest Indian bowler to 50 Test wickets at home
content: Jasprit Bumrah became the fastest Indian to 50 Test wickets at home by balls bowled, reaching the milestone in 1,747 deliveries. He claimed 3/42, alongside Mohammed Siraj's 4/40, as India dismissed West Indies for 162. India now holds a commanding position in the opening Test.

title: 39 RSS men held in TN; Stalin govt says no permit for puja, 'shakha' training in school
content: Chennai Police detained 39 RSS members near Porur for holding a Guru Puja and special shakha training at a government school without permission. This detention coincided with the RSS centenary, which drew sharp criticism from Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, who condemned the central government's commemorative stamp and coin release.

title: US govt shutdown: How long will the deadlock continue; what to expect in coming days
content: The United States government has entered a shutdown after Congress failed to reach a spending agreement, triggering widespread disruption across federal agencies. Hundreds of thousands of federal workers face furloughs or delayed pay, while essential services continue without immediate compensation. The closure's duration is uncertain, with significant economic costs and a need for political compromise to resolve the deadlock.

title: Shivakumar warns party workers against CM post talk; KPCC told to issue notices
content: Karnataka deputy CM DK Shivakumar warned Congress leaders against discussing a change in chief minister, emphasizing his collaboration with CM Siddaramaiah and adherence to high command directives. This warning followed an MLA's public support for Shivakumar as future CM, prompting Siddaramaiah to reiterate his commitment to a full five-year term, denying any rotational agreement.

title: 'Zionists and RSS twin brothers': Kerala CM remarks on Sangh centenary
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan compared RSS to Zionists. He called them twin brothers. Vijayan criticized Prime Minister Modi over US H-1B visa fee hikes. He also questioned Modi's response to increased tariffs on Indian goods. The Chief Minister condemned the release of a postage stamp and coin for the RSS centenary. He stated this insulted the Constitution.

title: 'Assault' by actor Dimple: Maid flees Hyderabad flat with torn clothes after incident
content: Actress Dimple Hayathi and her husband David face police charges for allegedly harassing their 22-year-old domestic help. The complainant reported repeated abuse, denial of food, and humiliation. She further alleged David snatched and smashed her phone during an incident. Film Nagar police registered a case under relevant sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, and notices will be served for questioning.

title: WWE star Shane McMahon’s son Declan joins ESPN for summer internship
content: Declan McMahon, son of WWE's Shane McMahon, recently completed a summer internship at ESPN, signaling his growing interest in sports media beyond college football. This opportunity, revealed by Linda McMahon, could forge significant career connections, especially with WWE's new partnership with ESPN. Declan has also publicly supported his family's WWE legacy, hinting at a promising future bridging both industries.

title: 4 deaths in 2 days trigger protests in Punjab village; 20,000 FIRs in 7 mnths
content: Ferozepur's Lakho Ke Behram village is reeling after four young men died from alleged drug addiction in two days, sparking widespread outrage. Residents accuse the Punjab government and police of failing its "war against drugs," alleging easy drug availability and official inaction. Families shared harrowing tales of addiction's devastation.

title: ILT20 auction: Ashwin under scanner after going unsold
content: Indian off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin went unsold at the ILT20 2025 auction, with reports suggesting he withdrew his availability despite a high base price. Commentator Simon Doull found this surprising, given teams had significant funds. Ashwin, now available for global leagues, is confirmed for the BBL and interested in The Hundred.

title: OpenAI valuation: ChatGPT parent is now worth $500 bn; more than SpaceX and ByteDance
content: OpenAI's valuation has surged to $500 billion after employees and former staff cashed out $6.6 billion in a secondary share sale to investors including SoftBank and Thrive Capital. This significant increase from $300 billion highlights the AI giant's rapid growth, with revenue reaching $4.3 billion in the first half of 2025. OpenAI now surpasses SpaceX and ByteDance in valuation.

title: AP Dhillon house shooting: Bishnoi gang member sentenced to 6 years
content: A man received a six-year jail term for an attack at musician AP Dhillon's home. Abjeet Kingra, an alleged associate of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, pleaded guilty. The incident involved gunshots and vehicles set ablaze in Colwood. This sentencing follows Canada's move to list the Bishnoi Gang as a terrorist entity. Authorities continue to seek another suspect in the case.

title: Watch: Illegal mosque on govt land bulldozed in Sambhal; SP says 30-day notice ignored
content: Authorities in Uttar Pradesh’s Sambhal district demolished illegal structures in Rae Buzurg village after a 30-day notice. The buildings, including a madrasa and wedding hall, were built on pond land without authorization. Officials said due process was followed, and no appeals were filed. Drone surveillance was used during the operation, which is part of an ongoing anti-encroachment drive.

title: 'Deeply ironic': India slams Pakistan at UN; calls out persecution of minorities on its soil
content: At the UN, India slammed Pakistan for hypocrisy on human rights and support for terrorism. Indian diplomats rebuked Pakistan’s claims as propaganda, citing its persecution of minorities and recent civilian deaths in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. India also criticised Pakistan’s sheltering of terrorists and duplicity at global forums. Earlier, India had rebuked Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif’s UNGA remarks as absurd theatrics and misinformation

title: 21-yr-old YouTube-trained hacker ran piracy syndicate; $100K crypto seized
content: A 21-year-old Patna college dropout, Ashwani Kumar, emerged as a central figure in India's movie piracy network. Using self-taught hacking skills, he breached digital cinema distributors, downloading over 120 unreleased films. Telangana police arrested him, seizing HD prints and freezing $100,000 in crypto. His sophisticated operation, learned from YouTube, exposed major industry cybersecurity flaws, serving as a critical wake-up call.

title: Happy Dussehra: 75+ messages, greetings and quotes for positivity and good luck
content: Dussehra, or Vijayadashami, is a pivotal Hindu festival celebrating the victory of good over evil. It commemorates Lord Rama's triumph over Ravana and Maa Durga's defeat of Mahishasura, symbolizing truth, dharma, and feminine power. Celebrated diversely across India, this auspicious day reminds devotees that righteousness and courage always prevail, inspiring hope and devotion.

title: US govt shutdown: Why it happened and how much it’s costing per day — Explained in 10 points
content: 24 hours in to the US govt shutdown Republicans and Democrats are still deadlocked over healthcare funding. Around 750,000 federal workers are furloughed, services disrupted, and national sites closed. The dispute centres on subsidies under the Affordable Care Act. The shutdown costs $400 million daily with no immediate resolution in sight.

title: CBSE launches mental health series; teachers and students to participate
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE), in collaboration with AIIMS, will conduct a Virtual Mental Health Series from October 4 to 10, 2025, for principals, teachers, counselors, parents, and students. Aimed at promoting psychological resilience, reducing stigma, and addressing academic stress, the series will feature expert-led sessions covering nutrition, emotional health, digital challenges, and high-risk adolescent behaviour.

title: Mallikarjun Kharge hospitalised: PM Modi dials Congress chief to enquire about health
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi contacted Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge to inquire about his health. Kharge, 83, was hospitalised in Bengaluru after experiencing uneasiness and breathlessness, undergoing an angiogram and pacemaker procedure. Doctors report him stable in cardiac ICU, with a viral fever noted earlier.

title: US tariffs to Nepal Gen Z protest: Mohan Bhagwat's RSS centenary programme address — Top quotes
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat led the organisation's centenary celebrations in Nagpur, performing Shastra Puja. In his address, Bhagwat confronted India's pressing challenges, from cross-border terrorism and internal destabilisation to the alarming state of the Himalayas due to climate change. He strongly advocated for national self-reliance and strategic diplomacy, urging a critical re-evaluation of current development models.

title: 'Came to kill comedian Munawar Faruqi': 2 Goldy Brar gang members arrested after gunfight
content: Delhi Police arrested two men, Rahul and Sahil, following a shootout in Kalindi Kunj early Thursday. Injured, they are linked to the December 2024 Haryana triple murder case and the Rohit Godara syndicate. Police stated the duo was planning to target a social media influencer, having conducted reconnaissance in Mumbai and Bengaluru. Firearms were seized.

title: Karan Kundrra slams ex-girlfriend Anusha Dandekar over cheating allegations
content: Karan Kundrra slammed Anusha Dandekar on Instagram after she accused him of cheating, claiming he used a dating app they promoted together to meet other women. He expressed frustration, stating men like him are unfairly targeted by "cruel elite women" and lack support. Anusha detailed how he allegedly slept with "all of Mumbai" during their relationship.

title: ‘I Love Mohammad’ row: Bareilly seals banquet halls, farmhouses; 600 weddings hit
content: Bareilly authorities sealed seven banquet halls and farmhouses, disrupting hundreds of upcoming weddings. This action followed clashes related to an unauthorized "I Love Muhammad" campaign gathering, with many sealed properties linked to a minority leader. The administration cited illegal construction, leaving affected families scrambling for alternative venues and facing significant problems.

title: Watch: Israel intercepts boat with Greta onboard; video shows vessels sprayed with water cannons
content: The Israeli navy intercepted a humanitarian flotilla en route to Gaza, detaining activists including Greta Thunberg. Israel claimed the vessels aimed for provocation, not aid, citing a lawful naval blockade. However, the Global Sumud Flotilla condemned the interception as illegal, alleging ramming and communication interference against their peaceful aid mission.

title: 2 kids die from cough syrup in Rajasthan; doc tests it, found unconscious after 8 hrs
content: A Rajasthan doctor collapsed after consuming government-supplied cough syrup, now linked to two child deaths and multiple illnesses. The state has banned 22 batches, recalled existing stock, and launched an inquiry into the widely distributed medicine. Authorities halted supplies from Kayson Pharma, advising against its administration to children under five.

title: Leon Mendonca's journey: From battling illness to becoming World Cup rseserve
content: From sibling rivalry in Goa to becoming the state’s second Grandmaster, 19-year-old Leon Luke Mendonca’s journey has been shaped by family sacrifice and resilience. After illness marred his Tata Steel Masters debut, the teenager rebounded with consistent performances to earn a World Cup reserve spot in Goa, underlining his persistence in chasing the next level of global chess.

title: Yamamoto puts L.A. in NLDS; Ohtani to start G1
content: Yoshinobu Yamamoto struck out nine to lead the Dodgers past the Reds and into the NLDS, where Shohei Ohtani will start the opener against the Phillies.

title: Chisholm turns page, saves Yanks to force Game 3
content: One day after he was benched, Jazz Chisholm turned in a season-saving performance for the Yankees, making a run-saving play with his glove and scoring the tiebreaking run in Wednesday's do-or-die Game 2 against the Red Sox.

title: Machado makes Cubs pay for Imanaga 'mistake'
content: Cubs manager Craig Counsell defended his decision to leave lefty Shota Imanaga in the game to face Padres slugger Manny Machado, who hit a two-run home run.

title: Colts' Howard abruptly retires, says 'family first'
content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

title: Sources: Panthers, Mikkola finalizing extension
content: An extension with Niko Mikkola means the Panthers will have their top four defensemen locked in until at least 2030.

title: Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B private capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: Nashville lifts 1st major trophy with Open Cup win
content: Nashville SC beat Austin FC 2-1 in final of the U.S. Open Cup on Wednesday night at Q2 Stadium to win the team's first-ever major trophy.

title: A.J. Brown says post wasn't about Eagles, Hurts
content: Eagles receiver A.J. Brown took responsibility Wednesday for letting his "frustrations boil over" Sunday and stated that his post on social media wasn't directed at anyone inside the building, including quarterback Jalen Hurts.

title: 📉 College football Bottom 10: Penn State's woe
content: Under the brightest lights, the Nittany Lions came up short again, earning them a spot on our dubious list.

title: Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards: The top candidates to win MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: The latest buzz: More on the Ravens’ struggles, Titans' trauma, and potential QB trades
content: See the latest intel on the Ravens' disappointing start, options for 0-4 Tennessee and more heading into Week 5.

title: Ranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: A surprise No. 1, where's Arch Manning and more
content: What have we learned about the signal-callers so far? Here's where Arch Manning, Beau Pribula and others stand.

title: Carson Beck: The injury, the Lamborghini, a very public breakup and a career revived
content: After struggling in the spotlight at Georgia, the quarterback is in position to make another national title run.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Your guide to the WNBA Finals: Aces-Mercury predictions and how each team could win
content: A'ja Wilson's Aces seek their third title in four years. Phoenix is chasing its first since 2014. The Finals open Friday.

title: MLB wild-card series: Who will stay alive in win-or-go-home Game 3s?
content: It's elimination Thursday with three winner-take-all games in the wild-card round! We've got it all covered for you.

title: A Phillies vs. Dodgers NLDS?! Here's how each team can win it
content: The first division series is set! Here's how L.A. and Philly stack up for a clash of National League titans.

title: World Series Drought-Buster Watch: Which teams could end longest runs without titles?
content: Some contenders that haven't won it all in decades -- or ever -- have reason to believe this is their year.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 5
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: 'Can't complain; I'm liking life': Mitch Marner begins his Vegas era
content: The top free agent from the summer is ready to begin a new chapter with an elite Western Conference contender.

title: UCL talking points: Liverpool in trouble? Mbappé rescuing Real? Are PSG, Barça the best?
content: The Champions League gave us plenty to break down in Matchday 2, from Liverpool's latest defeat to Kylian Mbappe rescuing Real Madrid. Our experts tell you what to make of the games.

title: NFL kickoffs: Rules change results in most returns in history through Week 4
content: Here's a look at how the latest tweak to kickoffs resulted in yet another big jump in special teams action.

title: 10 NBA teams that gained -- or lost -- the most value in offseason deals
content: From trades to free agency to the draft, these teams will see boosts -- or declines -- from a summer of deals.

title: Roster battles, extension breakdowns and what to watch at NBA training camps
content: From superstar salaries to on-court adjustments, here are the biggest things to watch for heading into 2025 NBA training camps.

title: Betting buzz: Ravens swing from favorite to underdog amid Jackson injury rumors
content: Amid speculation around Lamar Jackson's hamstring injury, the Ravens have swung from favorite to underdogs on Sunday.

title: College football betting: Buckeyes, Ducks the favorites for national title, Heisman
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet them.

title: What Premier League pass maps tell us: Salah needs the ball, Man United rely on Shaw
content: The top Premier League teams have passed the ball in certain ways that betray either a weakness or a strength. What have we learned so far?

title: Every time Man United's Ruben Amorim has talked about his job
content: Ahead of a must-win match against Sunderland, here is everything Amorim has said about his job so far.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Como offer Man United's Zirkzee an escape
content: Manchester United forward Joshua Zirkzee is contemplating a move to Serie A side Como in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Which pitchers are MVPs, LVPs of 2025?
content: Eric Karabell looks back on the fantasy baseball season and hands out his MVPs and LVPs for pitchers.

title: Draft strategy: The best picks for each slot in Rounds 1 and 2
content: The top of your fantasy hockey draft is important, so we've mapped out how the top 20 picks should go.

title: Husband, 6 In-Laws Charged For Dowry Death, Woman Turns Up Alive After 2 Years
content: A woman over whose 'death' her husband and in-laws were facing a dowry death case for two years has now been found alive.

title: 2 Killed In Stabbing Attack In UK's Manchester, Suspect Shot Dead
content: Two people were killed and three critically wounded after a car was driven into members of the public followed by a stabbing attack outside a synagogue near UK's Manchester.

title: OpenAI Valuation Soars To $500 Billion In Private Share Sale: Report
content: The valuation of ChatGPT developer OpenAI soared to a chart-topping $500 billion in a deal for employees to sell a limited number of shares, financial media reported Thursday.

title: 'Attack On Democracy Biggest Threat To India': Rahul Gandhi In Colombia
content: Targeting the Narendra Modi government, Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi has said the biggest threat to India is the "attack on democracy"

title: UP Businessman's Murder, A Religious Leader On The Run, And An Affair Claim
content: Hindu Mahasabha leader Pooja Shakun Pandey, who made headlines in 2019 for a shocking enactment of Mahatma Gandhi's assassination, is on the run in a murder case in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh

title: Trump's Polarising Campaign Backed By Unemployed: Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress's Rahul Gandhi has taken a jibe at US President Donald Trump today, saying his "polarising campaign is backed by the unemployed".

title: Amid Layoffs, TCS Says Impacted Employees Have Been Given "Care And Support"
content: Months after Tata Consultancy Services announced that it would reduce its workforce by 2 per cent in its 2026 financial year, the company has said it is providing "care and support" to employees hit by the restructuring.

title: Delhi's Purana Qila To Host 3-Day 'Indraprastha Dance Festival' Starting Tomorrow
content: The historic Purana Qila is set to become a grand stage for Indian classical dance with the launch of inaugural edition of "Indraprastha Nritya Mahotsav", starting from Friday.

title: When Primatologist Jane Goodall Compared Trump To Male Chimpanzees
content: British chimpanzee expert, Jane Goodall, died on Wednesday at the age of 91. Today, a day later, one of her old interviews, in which the famed primatologist compared US President Donald Trump to her beloved animal, chimpanzees, has resurfaced.

title: "That Son Of A Bi**h": Late Night Host Jimmy Kimmel Hits Out At Trump Again
content: Jimmy Kimmel and Stephen Colbert, two of America's biggest late-night hosts, swapped chairs and stories in a mega crossover Tuesday.

title: Video: In Bhopal, Drunk Men Set Ravan Effigy Afire On Dussehra Morning
content: A Ravan effigy in Bhopal neighbourhood met its end unceremoniously and without pomp, thanks to a drunk group of youngsters who set it on fire early this morning.

title: DK Shivakumar Warns Party Workers Over Discussing Leadership Change
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has warned Congress workers against discussing leadership change in the state.

title: Outrage After Sheikh Hasina's Aide Seen Handcuffed To Hospital Bed Before Death
content: The Muhammad Yunus government in Bangladesh is under fire for human rights violations after the death of a senior Awami League leader.

title: US To Terminate Clean Energy Projects, Freeze Funding For New York Projects
content: The Trump administration has announced plans to terminate dozens of clean energy projects and freeze billions of dollars for major projects in New York, intensifying a stand-off with Democrats over a US government shutdown.

title: After Losing 3 Children, Gaza Mother Struggles To Save Two-Year-Old Daughter From Cancer
content: Nancy Abu Matroud has already lost three children during Gaza's war. Now, the Palestinian mother, 22, is fighting to save her daughter, Etra - a two-year-old cancer patient newly deprived of vital medical care

title: "Mumma, Let Her Go": Woman Keeps Thrashing Mother-In-Law, Ignores Pleading Son
content: The viral video starts with the mother, Harjeet Kaur, dragging her mother-in-law Gurbajan Kaur by her hair. When her son begs her to let go of his grandmother, she does so but keeps raining blows and expletives on her.

title: US To Halt Funding For Organisations Supporting Trans And Diversity Work Overseas: Report
content: The Trump administration plans to halt federal funding of any organisation or government that supports work overseas related to gender identity or diversity, Politico reported on Wednesday, citing a US official

title: India's Big Warning To Pakistan Against Aggressive Approach Towards Sir Creek
content: In a clear message to Pakistan, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday warned the neighbouring country against any aggression towards the Sir Creek region and said that any such move would be met with a "resounding response".

title: 'Where Am I Safe?': Trans People Fear Harassment After UK Court's Ruling
content: In April, the UK Supreme Court affirmed that under equality laws, the term "sex" refers to biological sex, meaning a transgender woman is legally considered male, and a transgender man is considered female.

title: Comic Munawar Faruqui In Gang's Crosshairs For Jokes On Hindu Gods: Sources
content: Stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui is in the crosshairs of gangsters Rohit Godara and Goldy Brar because they believe his jokes on Hindu gods hurt the community's sentiments

title: BJP slams Rahul Gandhi for his remarks at seminar in Colombia
content: Rahul Gandhi does it again, degrades India on foreign soil. From defaming our democracy in London, to mocking our institutions in the US, now in Colombia he spares no chance to insult Bharat globally, says BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia

title: Murder charge slapped on Zubeen Garg's manager, festival organiser: Assam Police
content: “The investigation is going on, and I cannot share much detail. We have added Section 103 of the BNS in the FIR now,”Special DGP of Assam Police’s CID said

title: BJP leader threatens retaliation after Cherukkunnu bomb attack
content: March taken out to protest against the pre-dawn bomb attack on BJP Kalliasseri constituency committee general secretary K. Biju Narayanan’s house

title: PHC doctors’ strike: A.P. govt. agrees to provide quota for in-service candidates in all clinical branches
content: The PHC doctors, who suspended all services, both outpatient and emergency, at all PHCs in Andhra Pradesh from Monday, demanded that the quota finalised for them in admissions into PG courses for the year 2025-26 be reconsidered

title: Karnataka got lion’s share in NMC’s medical seat enhancement this year
content: This year, the NMC sanctioned additional seats to 808 medical colleges across India, out of which a total of 900 additional seats have been made available to 16 medical colleges in Karnataka

title: Renowned Gandhian G.G. Parikh passes away at 101
content: G.G. Parikh was a Gandhian, a freedom fighter, an upholder of democratic socialism, and a builder of labour movements and passed away on October 2, 2025

title: ‘Attack on democracy major risk to India’, says Rahul Gandhi in Colombia
content: Currently, there is a wholesale attack on this democratic system, and that is a major risk. Another big risk is the tension between different conceptions in parts of the country, says Conggress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Kerala Water Transport department to launch Kuttanad Safari eco-tourism boat service by November
content: An amphitheatre to be constructed on Pathiramanal island. To promote eco-friendly and responsible tourism, the amphitheatre will be built using sustainable materials such as grass and bamboo

title: 114 Odisha police job aspirants arrested while travelling to collect question paper in advance
content: Former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik said these repeated disruptions highlighted a troubling pattern in Odisha’s recruitment system, undermining trust and affecting lakhs of job seekers across the State

title: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge doing well after pacemaker implantation
content: The Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha is likely to be discharged either on Thursday night or Friday morning

title: Kalaignar TV moves Madras High Court against income tax proceedings related to 2G spectrum case
content: Questions the authority of an Assistant Director of Income Tax (Investigations) to conduct an inquiry during the pendency of appeal proceedings

title: Illegal marriage hall on pond land demolished in Sambhal; committee given 4 days for mosque removal
content: Tehsildar Dhirendra Pratap Singh said the demolition of the marriage hall was ordered by his court, along with the removal of the illegally-constructed mosque on reserved land

title: Electronics component manufacturing scheme receives 249 applications: IT Ministry
content: “Around double the expected investment commitments have been received in applications for the Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme,” IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said

title: BJP ‘playing politics’ over Karur tragedy, alleges TNCC president Selvaperunthagai
content: Mr. Selvaperunthagai criticised the BJP for forming an eight-member committee led by Lok Sabha MP, Hema Malini, contending she did not know even the north from south of Karur

title: Pan City LED Street Light project inaugurated in Kochi; Opposition challenges claims of better power efficiency
content: Under the project, conventional street lights have been replaced with over 40,000 smart and energy-efficient LED lights within Kochi Corporation limits

title: T.N. CM Stalin instructs officials to ensure facilities for paddy procurement, storage
content: Mr. Stalin held a meeting with collectors of five delta districts and officials of the Co-operative and Civil Supplies and Consumer Protection Department

title: Ramadoss appoints Tamil Kumaran as PMK youth wing president
content: Addressing a press conference at his Thailapuram residence, Mr. Ramadoss said months ago, he had previously appointed Mr. Kumaran to the post but Mr. Anbumani asked Mr. Kumaran to resign from the post immediately

title: Auto ‘Driverla Sevalo’ programme will be launched on October 4: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: CM Chandrababu Naidu said the ₹15,000 financial assistance scheme would be extended to nearly 2.9 lakh auto drivers whose income has dropped with the introduction of free bus scheme

title: Police department not under T.N. CM Stalin’s control, alleges Nainar Nagenthran
content: Referring to a recent incident of sexual assault on a teenager by two policemen in Tiruvannamalai, he alleged that several instances of police excesses had taken place in the State since the DMK came to power

title: Wayanad rehabilitation: Centre discriminating against Kerala, says K.C. Venugopal
content: Congress MP points out that though Kerala had sought a package of ₹2,219 crore, the Centre allocated only ₹260.56 crore

title: Koothuparamba MLA K.P. Mohanan attacked during protest at Panoor in Kerala’s Kannur
content: The incident occurred when the MLA arrived to inaugurate an anganwadi. The protest was over a garbage issue linked to a dialysis centre

title: On Gandhi Jayanti, T.N. CM Stalin criticises PM Modi over release of stamp marking RSS centenary
content: In a post on X, Mr. Stalin said the RSS movement “gave shape to the dreams of the communalist who assassinated the father of our nation”

title: Vidyarambham: Children take baby steps towards world of letters in Kerala
content: Celebrities, writers, intellectuals, politicians, and elderly personages from varied walks of life initiate children into the world of letter at temples, cultural institutions and newspaper offices

title: India a passionate football nation, honour to return: Messi
content: “India is a passionate football nation, and I look forward to meeting a new generation of fans while sharing the love I have for this beautiful game,” Messi said in an official statement

title: National Games in Meghalaya: Homestays to double up as Games Village for athletes
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K. Sangma stated that an announcement will soon be made to integrate the project into the Chief Minister’s Meghalaya Homestay Mission

title: Made in India Airbus H125 helicopter from Tata Advanced Systems Limited to roll out from Vemagal in Kolar district in 2027
content: The assembly line will be established by Tata Advanced Systems Limited (TASL) to build the Airbus H125 helicopters

title: Deep depression forms over Bay of Bengal off Andhra coast
content: It is very likely to continue to move north-northwestwards and cross Odisha and adjoining Andhra Pradesh coasts between Gopalpur and Paradip during October 2 night

title: Environment Minister Eshwar Khandre calls for increased wildlife week conservation, recalls recent animal deaths in Karnataka
content: Environment Minister Eshwar Khandre said in Bengaluru city alone, more than 250 acres of forest land worth about ₹10,000 crores had been cleared of encroachments. To preserve the city’s green cover, a huge botanical garden is being built on the model of Lalbagh on 153 acres in Madappanahalli.

title: Four new Kendriya Vidyalayas to Telangana in addition to existing 35 schools
content: BJP leader from Telangana and Union Coal and Mines Minister G. Kishan Reddy said the four new KVs in Telangana are in Bhadradri Kothagudem headquarters, Mulugu headquarters

title: Rare book on Mahatma Gandhi featuring Einstein’s signed quote surfaces in Kerala
content: Albert Einstein sent his signed message from Princeton University in New Jersey for inclusion in the book, published on October 2, 1944, with Gandhi’s permission

title: PM Modi speaks to Kharge, wishes him speedy recovery
content: Mallikarjun Kharge, 83, was admitted to M.S. Ramaiah Hospital in Bengaluru on September 30, 2025 and underwent a procedure for pacemaker implant the next day

title: Kerala Education Minister flays bid to ‘politicise’ aided school appointments
content: Referring to protests by certain aided school managements, Sivankutty says Kerala government ‘will not succumb to such pressures’

title: Heavy rain pounds Odisha, deep depression moving towards coast
content: The IMD issued an alert for heavy rains for all the 30 districts of Odisha on Thursday (October 2, 2025)

title: Irreparable loss to Indian music: President Murmu on Pandit Chhannulal Mishra's death
content: Pandit Channulal Mishra died of age-related ailments at his daughter's home in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur in the early hours of  October 2

title: Starting a war was not objective of Operation Sindoor: Rajnath Singh
content: Rajnath Singh referred to Pakistan’s “recent expansion of military infrastructure in areas adjacent to Sir Creek” and said, “Any aggression by Pakistan in the Sir Creek area will be met with a resounding response that will change both history and geography”

title: Bareilly division on high alert amid Dasara festivities; U.P. Govt suspends internet services for 48 hours, drones deployed
content: Police have been asked to be vigilant at Ramlila grounds, Durga Puja fairs and the Ravan Dahan programmes, which draw a massive footfall

title: Kerala CM slams Centre’s stamp and ₹100 coin for RSS centenary, calls it ‘grave insult to Constitution’
content: On Gandhi Jayanti, Pinarayi Vijayan sounds a warning against ‘perils posed by combative right-wing Hindu nationalism’ to India’s secular polity

title: Vijay hasn’t been named in FIR due to political reasons: Litigant complains before Madras High Court
content: Insists that permission should not be granted for road shows by any political party until the formulation of guidelines/Standard Operating Procedure

title: Gangsters contracted to kill comedian Munawar Faruqi held in Delhi after gunfire exchange
content: Identified as Rahul and Sahil from Haryana, they allegedly conducted reconnaissance in Mumbai and Bengaluru to track Mr. Faruqui’s movements, police said

title: Other nations’ positions after Pahalgam attack showed who India’s friends are: Mohan Bhagwat
content: Highlighting the turmoil in neighbouring countries like Nepal, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka, Mohan Bhagwat says such revolutions only bring instability

title: President Murmu, PM Modi, State CMs and other leaders pay homage to Gandhi, Shastri on birth anniversary
content: Leaders across India pay tributes to Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shastri on their birth anniversaries, emphasising their leadership and commitment to a self-reliant India

title: Bomb attack on BJP leader’s house in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Preliminary suspicion is that a group of assailants arrived on a motorbike to carry out the attack. Explosive remnants were recovered from the veranda

title: Watch: What are RBI’s new steps to promote internationalisation of the Rupee?
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said banks are now permitted to lend in Indian Rupees to non-residents from Bhutan, Nepal, and Sri Lanka for bilateral trade transactions, encouraging global use of the INR.

title: Russian President Putin set to visit India in early December
content: Ahead of Mr. Putin's trip, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov will travel to India next month to finalise the finer details of the presidential visit

title: Chhannulal Mishra, Hindustani classical singer, dies at 89
content: Chhannulal Mishra’s last rites will be performed in Varanasi at 5 p.m.; PM Modi condoles with Channulal Mishra’s kin, says ‘fortunate’ to have his blessings

title: Women's World Cup: No Handshake Policy for Women in Blue
content: It will also be closely watched as to who presents the toss in Colombo, with expectations that it would be a former player or pundit from a neutral nation.

title: Release of coin, stamp on RSS insult to Constitution: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) said the entire exercise is to "whitewash the shameful role of the RSS" which was not just distant from the freedom struggle but actually strengthened the British strategy of divide and rule.

title: Cough syrup linked to deaths of two children in Rajasthan; 22 batches of the drug banned
content: At least 8,200 bottles remain in stock at Jaipur's Sawai Man Singh Hospital, but authorities have instructed that they should not be given to patients.

title: Sonam Wangchuk’s wife writes to President Murmu for his release, seeks intervention on ‘witch-hunt’
content: Gitanjali Angmo, in her letter, asked if it was a sin to fight against reckless and unchecked development activities in an ecologically fragile area of Ladakh

title: CJI Gavai's mother Kamala Gavai says she won't attend RSS centenary  function in Maharashtra
content: “If I had been on the dais (at the October 5 RSS function), I would have put forward the Ambedkarite ideology,” Kamala Gavai wrote

title: Tejasvi Surya to head parliamentary panel on Jan Vishwas Bill, LS speaker reconstitutes committees
content: BJP leader Baijayant Panda was appointed chairman of the select committee to examine the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code Bill, while the chairpersons of almost all the department-related parliamentary panels, including Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, have been re-nominated to their respective positions

title: Ladakh L-G chairs security review meeting, says restrictions to be lifted in a phased manner
content: Kavinder Gupta lauded the relentless efforts of the security forces and the civil administration in restoring normalcy over the past week

content: Pointing to a recent DMK “Mupperum Vizha” in Karur, which drew nearly 2.5 lakh people, Mr. Senthilbalaji contrasted the preparations

title: ‘Congress is a party of factions and internal rifts’ says Haryana CM Saini

title: Cabinet approves ₹11,440 crore mission to make India self-sufficient in pulses
content: The "Mission for Aatmanirbharta in Pulses", approved by the Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, will be for the period from 2025-26 to 2030-31

title: India, EFTA trade pact comes into force: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
content: The Union Commerce Minister said the pact will unlock new opportunities for trade, investment and job creation, benefiting people and businesses

content: Mr. Gupta lashes out at Rahul Gandhi for his remarks on the Ladakh situation, alleging that the Congress leader was trying to “vitiate the atmosphere” in the country

title: Search operation launched after suspicious movement in J&K’s Kathua

title: Watch: What happened on September 27, the night of the stampede in Karur? | Reporter’s Diary
content: What began as routine political rally by actor-turned politician Vijay’s TVK in Karur soon spiralled into chaos and at least 41 people died in a stampede. The Hindu’s C. Jaisankar was on the ground that fateful day. This is his first-hand account of how the tragedy unfolded.

title: Mortar shell defused along LoC in J&K’s Rajouri
content: The shell is believed to have landed in the village from across the border during cross-border shelling during Operation Sindoor in May

title: GST collections rise by 9% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in September
content: The GST collections were 9.1% higher than the same month a year ago and over 1.5% higher than the previous month

title: India welcome to collect Asia Cup trophy from me at ACC office in Dubai: Mohsin Naqvi
content: In a post on X, Mr. Naqvi rejected reports claiming that he, at the ACC AGM on Tuesday (September 30), apologised to BCCI officials for his actions at the presentation ceremony

title: Bareilly violence: 2 'outsiders' with criminal history nabbed after gunfight with police
content: District Magistrate Avinash Singh on Wednesday (October 1) said nearly 80 accused have been identified in the case, and arms licences of half a dozen people are being cancelled.

title: PM unveils ₹100 coin, stamp at RSS centenary; first-ever depiction of Bharat Mata on Indian currency
content: In the mission of building a developed India by 2047, the contribution of the Sangh will be crucial, said PM Modi.

title: Dowry cases rise by 14% in 2023; over 6,100 women killed: NCRB
content: Uttar Pradesh again topped the chart with 2,122 deaths, followed by Bihar with 1,143. Dowry was listed as the motive in 833 murder cases across the country in 2023

title: Civic notice to school for 'ban' on religious, cultural symbols
content: The controversy erupted after some parents raised objections over students being prohibited from wearing 'tilak' or 'tikli' (bindi) on their foreheads, bangles, and rakhi or sacred threads.

title: 150 years of national song ‘Vande Mataram’ to be celebrated across India: Union Cabinet
content: Briefing reporters on the decisions taken by the Union Cabinet, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that keeping in mind the role played by the song during the freedom struggle, a decision was taken to hold country-wide celebrations to mark its 150th year.

title: Rajesh Agrawal takes charge as Commerce Secretary
content: Rajesh Agrawal was the chief negotiator for the India-U.S. Bilateral Trade Agreement, Indo-Pacific Economic Forum, India-Australia CECA, and review of the ASEAN FTA

title: Cabinet hikes wheat MSP by ₹160 per quintal to ₹2,585

title: Congress did protest Rahul death threat, CPI(M) ministers 'mistaken': LoP Satheesan
content: Satheesan said that the threat by the BJP leader, Printu Mahadevan, was made on a news channel on September 26

title: Centre hikes Dearness Allowance/Dearness Relief by 3%; to benefit 1.18 crore employees, pensioners
content: The DA/DR increase of 3% over the existing rate of 55% of the basic pay/pension to compensate against the price rise is effective July 1, 2025

content: Anil Joshi’s joining came days after he met Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and party general secretary (organisation) K.C. Venugopal in Delhi

title: Ennore building collapse: PMK demands inquiry, seeks compensation for victims
